detailsOfAchievement: The major activities of Pratishruti Foundation is to propagate and promote Sattriya Dance,the classical dance of Assam through: 1.Dance Festivals 2.Seminars 3.Presenting Lectures-Demonstration of Sattriya Dance 4. Giving opportunities to young dancers 5. Teaching and Choreographing for Young dancers 6.Working on projects with other classical dance forms. The foundation has organised 12 Dance Festivals and many lecture demonstrations. It has organised a Seminar on the Classical Dance traditions of Assam which was well acclaimed all over the country. It has given opportunities to many artistes both old and young from the Sattras and other parts of Assam. It has felicitated the elderly artists for their contribution in the field of art and culture.It has many more projects for the coming years. It will continue to work and dedicate all energies towards propagation and promotion of art and culture.

title: PRAVARA INSTITUTE OF MEDICAL SCIENCES
detailsOfAchievement: Pravara Institute of Medical Sciences (PIMS) - established in 2001, promoted by PMT. PIMS - the only rural medical university in India, pioneered in socially meaningful, community oriented medical and allied health sciences education. PIMS attained the status of Deemed University in 2003 under section 3 of UGC Act 1956 of Govt of India. PIMS - DU was accredited by NAAC with CGPA of 2.57 on 4.00 Point Scale at B grade valid up to September 15, 2016. ACTIVITIES PIMS â€“ Deemed University has promoted the following network of medical education & Research Organizations and Primary to Tertiary level Hospitals 1. 1250 bedded multi-specialty Pravara Rural Teaching Hospital, Loni - 1976, 2. Rural Medical College, Loni â€“ 1984 3. School of Nursing, Loni â€“ 1986 4. Rural Dental College & Hospital, Loni â€“ 1989 5. College of Physiotherapy & Rehabilitation Centre, Loni -1991 6. Rural Cancer Treatment & Research Centre, Loni â€“ 1997 7. College of Nursing, Loni - 2001 8. Centre for Biotechnology, Loni â€“ 2001 9. Centre for Social Medicine, Loni â€“ 2001 10. College of Ayurveda, Shevgaon â€“ 2005 11. School of Nursing, Shevgaon â€“ 2008 The above constituent institutions of PIMS University, currently offers 6 Bachelorâ€™s (MBBS, BDS, BPhT, BSc (Nursing), BAMS, BSc (Med. Biotech)), 41 Masterâ€™s degree and diploma (M.D/M.S, MDS, M.Ph.T, M.Sc (Nursing), MSc (Biotech), MBA (Bioscience Mgt.), MSc (Pre-clinical & Para-clinical) MSc (Public Health), MSW (Medical)), 20 Doctoral, and 11 diploma and certificate programs in medicine, dentistry, nursing, physiotherapy, medical biotechnology, social medicine/health, bio-science management, ayurveda and other para-medical sciences. The PIMS University has three Campuses. Its main campus located in Loni village, has been developed as a self sufficient township with all modern amenities for supporting 3500 students, staff/faculty and their families, to live, work and study, on a 130 acre lush green, environmental friendly, pollution free atmosphere. The other two campuses are located in about 100 Kms away, at Sinner (Nashik District) for Bioscience Management and Shevgaon (Ahmednagar district) for Ayurved College & Nursing School. ACHIEVEMENTS The medical care, academic, research, and extension programs and projects implemented by Pravara Institute of Medical Sciences - Loni, has shown its sustainable impact, over a period of time, at local, state, national and international level in improving the health status of the people of rural and urban slums, providing well trained medical and para-medical man power to reduce the urban-rural gap, demystify medicine to bring positive behavioural changes for health promotion in the community at large and convincing people that â€œhealth is their own handsâ€. The health indicators like CBR (12.8 per 1000 population), CDR (4.1 per 1000 population), IMR (18 per 1000 live births), MMR (130 per 1 lakh live births), Institutional deliveries (85%) etc of the people of the remote rural, tribal and urban slum areas being served by the Model are far ahead of the District, State and National averages. The man power trained by the Model is well equipped and has been serving in both rural areas as well as super-specialty hospitals in metropolitan cities in India and abroad.

detailsOfAchievement: The Organization has promoted a comprehensive rural health care model in remote rural area of Ahemednagar district by establishing a network of tertiary to primary level hospitals/health centres & rehabilitation centres, medical and health sciences educational, training and research institutes (Rural Medical College, Rural Dental College, College of Nursing, College of Physiotherapy, Centre for Biotechnology, Centre for Social Medicine, School of Bioscience Management) and comminity health and developmental projects. The 800 bedded multispecialty postgraduate teaching hospital, rural cancer treatment centre and 9 rural health health centres, extension OPDs, 5 mobile medical & dental clinics & free medical treatment camps run by the trust covers the remote rural and tribal areas of Ahemdangar and its neighbouring districts in Maharashtra. The Trust is recognized by MoHFW, Govt. of India as Mother NGO in 1998 for implemening its RCH, NRHM and AYUSH schemes in rural Maharashtra. The Trust has implemented nearly 20 major community health and development projects including RCH, HIV/AIDS, Elderly care, Adolescent Health, Differntly abled care, Village Enviroment and Sanitation, Cancer Prevention and Awareness, supported by central and state governments, international funding agencies like USAID, Sida, Pathfinder International etc.

detailsOfAchievement: Ours is the first college in Maharashtra, established at Grampanchayat level in 1971to provide the opportunity of higher education to rural youth. At present the college has 2870 students (1402 boys and 1468 girls) with qualified and experienced teaching staff. The college offers 19 Under Graduate, 17 Post Graduate courses including Biotechnology and Computer Science, 7 recognized research centers in Chemistry, Botany, Zoology, Environmental Sciences, Commerce, Physics and Economics. Besides 11 Career Oriented and 3 Open University Courses are also offered. Awards and recognitions received â€¢ Best Rural College Award twice from University of Pune (2002 & 2010) â€¢ Re-accredited at â€˜Aâ€™ Grade with a CGPA of 3.61 from NAAC (2012) â€¢ ISO 9001:2008 Certification (2009) â€¢ Status of College with Potential for Excellence by UGC (2008) â€¢ Star College recognition from DBT New Delhi (2010) â€¢ DST-FIST Sponsored Department of Chemistry and Life Sciences (2005 & 2008) â€¢ Best NSS Unit award from University of Pune â€¢ Best College Magazine award from University of Pune â€¢ Best College Student welfare award from Savitribai Phule Pune University (2014-15) â€¢ College of Excellence (2014) â€¢ Community College (2014-15) This is the unique college in Maharashtra implementing restructuring programme at undergraduate level. The college has Earn and Learn scheme for poor and needy students, active Placement and Career Guidance Cell. The college has provided excellent infrastructure facilities and maintained good academic ambiance from its inception. â€¢ Green and serene campus with area of 32 Hectares 5R. â€¢ 34 classrooms, 51 well-equipped laboratories, 4 seminar halls, along with conference hall. â€¢ Virtual Learning Centre and free Internet facility. â€¢ Central Research Laboratory and Computerized Central Library. â€¢ Separate carpentry, workshop and civil department for repairs and maintenance. â€¢ Excellent Hostels and sports facilities. â€¢ Computer Literacy programme for new entrants of the college.
